result.execSummary:
The defendant KYLE R CHIPMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KYLE R CHIPMAN

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:10 PM Defendant KYLE R CHIPMAN in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce in court for KYLE R CHIPMAN. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2021CF125 and count 1 in 2022CF1 with probation and the balance of the counts and 2021CM187 are to be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Pierce concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2021CF125 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in; Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2022CF1 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders 2021CM187 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Pierce. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF125 (ct 1) / 2022CF1 (ct 1) - EACH

-SWD and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS: (EACH)

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 3:19 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:06 PM Defendant KYLE R CHIPMAN appeared by video.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce appeared by video for KYLE R CHIPMAN. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Pierce states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Pierce. Attorney Pierce acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Pierce enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 4:08 PM

Court will set all cases for Plea & Sentencing on May 3, 2022 at 3:00 PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Second appearance on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:45 AM Defendant KYLE R CHIPMAN appeared in court, Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared in court for KYLE R CHIPMAN, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def qualifies for the public defender. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA  Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for status of counsel for March 08, 2022 at 10:00 AM. 

Court adjourned at 9:47 AM.
